value.title: 8 helpful tips for Power BI service
value.excerpt: This 8 tips will help you administrate and configure Power Bi service like a Pro. If you are not an admin, make sure you check it as some of the features are useful to you if they are configured :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more

value.title: Add Leading and ending zeros with Power Query #2: (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's tutorial, I will show you how to add leading zeros and ending zeros to your text/ number columns using Power BI and the M language.   Looking for a download file? Go to our Download Center: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Add prefix to headers in Power Query #1: (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's video you will learn how to add a prefix to all column headers using Power Query and the M language.  We will use the Table.PrefixColumns M function to add a prefix to all column headers in the table at the same time. Time saver function!   Looking for a download file? Go to our Download Center:

value.title: Avoid filtering issues in Power Query
value.excerpt: Sometimes when you are filtering columns,  Power Query will create a filtering query that was probably not what you expected and it will either break your queries, or it will filter out values you want.  Let me show you!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Create a bump or slope chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: Bump or slope charts are useful to sport changes between categories. There is no native bump or slope visual in Power BI, but you can create your own easily from a line chart. In this video I show you how. #curbal #power bi #bumpcharts  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
